meanings.definition: A frame on which cloth is stretched for drying or finishing.
meanings.sent1: The tenters held the fabric taut as it dried in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The old mill had rows of tenters where the cloth was carefully stretched.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the tenters were a great place to play hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the sturdy tenters, keeping her focused on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The colorful fabric on the tenters fluttered in the breeze, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To stretch or strain on a tenter.
meanings.sent1: She carefully tenters the wet cloth to ensure it dries evenly.
meanings.sent2: The workers tenters the material to prevent any wrinkles from forming.
meanings.sent3: He tenters the truth a bit to make the story more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The coach tenters the team to push themselves harder in practice.
meanings.sent5: The singer tenters her voice to hit the high notes perfectly.
